content:
• Friday, July 5, 2013
  • ELP

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ELP +3%. CIG +2%. NBG +2%. HSOL +2%. EZPW +1%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ELP +3%. CIG +2%. NBG +2%. HSOL +2%. EZPW +1%.
    After-hours top losers: JASO -6%. SCHL -5%. CIK -4%. NPBC -4%. ACOR -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: OIL +7.6%. USO +6.9%. BNO +5.2%. TAN +4.1%. EWJ +3.3%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: OIL +7.6%. USO +6.9%. BNO +5.2%. TAN +4.1%. EWJ +3.3%.
    ETF Losers: VXX -7.8%. BRF -6.5%. GDXJ -6.5%. EWZ -5.4%. ILF -4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • LEU

    Shares of uranium supplier USEC (USU -40%) collapse, culminating a more than 50% drop in three...

    Shares of uranium supplier USEC (USU -40%) collapse, culminating a more than 50% drop in three sessions since a 1:25 reverse split took effect in a move to regain NYSE continued listing requirements.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • RIO

    Canada's two largest pension funds are sounding out potential partners for separate bids to...

    Canada's two largest pension funds are sounding out potential partners for separate bids to acquire Rio Tinto's (RIO -1.8%) ~$4B in Canadian iron ore assets, WSJ reports. CPP Investment Board is said to be working with Apollo Global (NYSE:APO) and others; Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and Glencore Xstrata (OTCPK:GLCNF) reportedly also have expressed interest. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • DAN

    Shares of Dana Holdings (DAN +5.8%) reach a record high in a week in which the company expanded...

    Shares of Dana Holdings (DAN +5.8%) reach a record high in a week in which the company expanded its stock buyback up to $1B, saw June auto sales come in strong, and received an upgrade from RBC Capital Markets to a Buy rating. Continued strength in the trucking sector in particular bodes well for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • PBR

    Whenever Petrobras (PBR -6.3%) looks ready to turn the corner, the Brazilian government seems to...

    Whenever Petrobras (PBR -6.3%) looks ready to turn the corner, the Brazilian government seems to do something to spoil it. This time, the decision to require PBR to participate in the Libra oilfield auction has the stock on its heels. As UBS explains, PBR will have to pay 4.5B reais to Brazil by year's end, and "investors seem afraid of super-regulation/intervention" as PBR needs to commit $100B in capex.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 5 Comments
  • APA

    Apache (APA +2.5%) bounces back from losses of nearly 5% in the week's first three trading...

    Apache (APA +2.5%) bounces back from losses of nearly 5% in the week's first three trading sessions, as Argus hikes 2013-14 earnings estimates and upgrades shares to Buy from Hold with a $95 target price on its expectations for higher energy prices in the coming quarters. APA holds 9.7M gross acres in Egypt’s Western Desert, although only 18% of the acreage has been developed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy (LINE +5.7%) turns sharply positive after sinking earlier to a three-year low...

    Linn Energy (LINE +5.7%) turns sharply positive after sinking earlier to a three-year low $20.35, perhaps caused by retail shorts deciding to cover ahead of Monday's ex-dividend date. Shares of LinnCo (LNCO -1.8%) and takeover target Berry Petroleum (BRY -1%) remain negative.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • CLDX

    Shares of Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +11.1%) soar yet again on heavy volume and look set to...

    Shares of Celldex Therapeutics (CLDX +11.1%) soar yet again on heavy volume and look set to close out the week with gains of more than 30%. Among the week's catalysts include an initiation at Guggenheim and the company's announcement that it has dosed the first patient in a CDX-1135 pilot study of dense deposit disease. In options action, volume looks heavily skewed to the call side at least for several near-the-money July and August strikes.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • KCG

    Midday top 10 gainers: KCG +232%. MEET +15%. PBMD +15%. YGE +14%. NBG +13%. CBAK-OLD +12%. SOL...

    Midday top 10 gainers: KCG +232%. MEET +15%. PBMD +15%. YGE +14%. NBG +13%. CBAK-OLD +12%. SOL +11%. JASO +11%. AFOP +11%. FMAR.OB +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: USU -11%. USMD -10%. ARR -10%. AXU -11%. ANH -10%. WRLD -9%. AU -9%. AMTG -9%. WMC -8%. NYMT -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • HBAN

    Regional banks (KRE +2%) are the day's strongest performers - sailing through today's big rise...

    Regional banks (KRE +2%) are the day's strongest performers - sailing through today's big rise in interest rates the way they cruised through June's increase. Interest rate margins are on the rise, economic growth should help sluggish loan volume, and the idea new bank capital rules will go easier on them than the TBTFs all factor in. Huntington (HBAN +2.9%), Regions (RF +1.8%), BB&T (BBT +1.9%), PNC (PNC +2.2%), Hudson City (HCBK +1.5%), Fifth Third (FITB +1.6%), SunTrust (STI +3.5%), KeyCorp (KEY +3%), Zions (ZION +3.5%), Comerica (CMA +2.7%), Popular (BPOP +1.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • JNY

    Shares of The Jones Group (JNY +5%) trek higher after dealReporter tips off a sale of the...

    Shares of The Jones Group (JNY +5%) trek higher after dealReporter tips off a sale of the company is in the early stages.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • DELL-OLD

    Michael Dell and Silver Lake are ruling out hiking their offer for Dell (DELL-OLD -3.8%),...

    Michael Dell and Silver Lake are ruling out hiking their offer for Dell (DELL-OLD -3.8%), Bloomberg reports. Shares have fallen to $12.80, more than 6% below the $13.65/share LBO price. They were already lower thanks to a report Silver Lake's commitment to the deal is wavering.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • BBEPQ

    BreitBurn Energy (BBEP -4.7%) is off its worst lows after CEO Halbert Washburn discloses buying...

    BreitBurn Energy (BBEP -4.7%) is off its worst lows after CEO Halbert Washburn discloses buying 30K shares on July 3 at an average $14.92, worth ~$447K. Shares have dropped 20% since Linn Energy's SEC inquiry news, which prompted Hedgeye to dub BBEP "Linn Energy junior." Other upstream MLPs also are lower: VNR -5.6%, QRE -6.5%, LRE -7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 4 Comments
  • TKR

    Shares of Timken (TKR +2.2%) hit a new 52-week high and are now up some 26% YTD as the company...

    Shares of Timken (TKR +2.2%) hit a new 52-week high and are now up some 26% YTD as the company mulls a spinoff of its steel business. Meanwhile, the stock's performance helped fuel a ~25% gain for activist fund Relational Investors which has spearheaded the push for the split.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • WMC

    More on the carnage in mREITs (REM -5.2%): The pain seems worst  for agency REITs and those...

    More on the carnage in mREITs (REM -5.2%): The pain seems worst  for agency REITs and those most exposed to fixed rates. Western Asset (WMC -9.8%), Ellington Residential (EARN -6.5%), AG Mortgage (MITT -7.5%), Apollo (AMTG -6.7%). Owners of ARMs like Hatteras (HTS -6.6%) and Capstead (CMO -6.4%) aren't spared either. Less torched are stocks like Dynex (DX -2.7%) and Ellington Financial (EFC -3.3%) - both with plenty of non-agency paper on their books and thought to be a well-hedged as they come (yes, we know EFC is a partnership, not an mREIT).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • GLNG

    Golar LNG (GLNG +2.4%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell with a $32.50 price target at Goldman...

    Golar LNG (GLNG +2.4%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell with a $32.50 price target at Goldman Sachs following recent underperformance. Since the firm added GLNG to its Sell list on May 14, shares are down 14% vs. the S&P 500's 2% drop; over the last 12 months, shares are down 18.4% vs. S&P's 17.6% gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • EXC

    Utilities stocks (XLU -1.2%) are under heavy selling pressure as interest rates soar: EXC -1.7%,...

    Utilities stocks (XLU -1.2%) are under heavy selling pressure as interest rates soar: EXC -1.7%, EIX -2%, FE -1.9%, PCG -1.5%, ED -1.4%, D -1.2%, PEG -1.3%, DUK -1.2%, NU -1.7%, SO -1%, NEE -1%, NRG -1.3%, SRE -1.6%, ETR -2.3%, XEL -1.7%, AEP -1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 7 Comments
  • HALO

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +2.5%) "is … a step closer to being able to reap the full...

    Halozyme Therapeutics (HALO +2.5%) "is … a step closer to being able to reap the full commercial potential of its rHuPH20 platform" thanks to a positive CHMP opinion for Herceptin, Edison Investment Research says, noting that this "opportunity currently drives" the stock's valuation. Additionally, analyst Jason Zhang believes the market is ignoring the potential of pipeline assets including PEGPH20. The Herceptin news recently helped the stock recover losses recorded in early June after data on PEGPH20 triggered a sell-off.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • ELX

    Argues' Jm Kelleher downgrades Emulex (ELX -2.4%) to Hold, leading shares to give back some of...

    Argues' Jm Kelleher downgrades Emulex (ELX -2.4%) to Hold, leading shares to give back some of the big Wednesday gains they saw thanks to a Bloomberg report that the company has put itself on sale. Kelleher thinks Emulex's current price could complicate the sale process, and is worried about integration issues. QLogic (QLGC -1.5%) is also lower, but Brocade (BRCD +3.5%) is rallying. SA contributor Fusion Research has made a bull case for Brocade, arguing Ethernet switch growth is offsetting storage switch weakness, and praising the company's improving margins, buybacks, and cost-cutting efforts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • YGE

    Chinese solar stocks continue to rally following reports a deal to end the EU's recently-imposed...

    Chinese solar stocks continue to rally following reports a deal to end the EU's recently-imposed Chinese import tariffs is close. A source tells Reuters the deal includes a quota for Chinese panel imports (anything sold in excess would be subject to duties), and prohibits them from being sold below production cost. YGE +7.8%. JASO +5.9%. LDK +3.9%. TSL +4.5%. JKS +3.7%. SOL +7.7%. CSIQ +2%. SunPower (SPWR +4.1%) is also rallying.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • MAN

    Select staffing stocks outperform market indexes following a payrolls report that signals some...

    Select staffing stocks outperform market indexes following a payrolls report that signals some strength in the labor market. Advancers: Manpower (NYSE:MAN) +4.3%, On Assignment  (NASDAQ:ASGN) +1.5%, Kelly Services (NASDAQ:KELYA) +1.2%, Trueblue (NYSE:TBI) +2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy (LINE -8.3%) and LinnCo (LNCO -10.8%) are off to another terrible start; shares have...

    Linn Energy (LINE -8.3%) and LinnCo (LNCO -10.8%) are off to another terrible start; shares have dropped ~38% and ~36% respectively since Tuesday's SEC inquiry announcement. The impact on Berry Petroleum (BRY -1.5%) has been less severe - shares have dropped ~7% - as some say its chances of getting another takeover offer are high if things don't work out with Linn.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 18 Comments
  • LEN

    The homebuilders (XHB -1.3%) take today's sharply higher interest rates hard. Lennar (LEN...

    The homebuilders (XHB -1.3%) take today's sharply higher interest rates hard. Lennar (LEN -3.9%), D.R. Horton (DHI -3.3%), Pulte (PHM -3.1%), Toll Brothers (TOL -3.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • MET

    A number of life insurers are at (or very near) new 52-week highs thanks to today's sharp rise...

    A number of life insurers are at (or very near) new 52-week highs thanks to today's sharp rise in interest rates which should allow investment at something closer to what's needed to meet their obligations. MetLife (MET +1.8%), Prudential (PRU +1.2%), Hartford (HIG +2.1%), Lincoln National (LNC +3.3%), Manulife (MFC +0.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • WRLD

    World Acceptance Corporation (WRLD -8.5%) dives after trying to sneak out late Wednesday news of...

    World Acceptance Corporation (WRLD -8.5%) dives after trying to sneak out late Wednesday news of further delay in amending its 10-K filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • ZTS

    More on BofA's Zoetis (ZTS +2.8%) upgrade which has the shares trading solidly higher on the...

    More on BofA's Zoetis (ZTS +2.8%) upgrade which has the shares trading solidly higher on the session: Analyst Robert Willoughby likes the prospects for EBITDA margin improvement in the coming years as a new ERP system and "changes in manufacturing and supply chain processes" should help reduce inventory.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • AGNC

    Panicky selling grips the mortgage REITs (REM -3.5%) as Treasury yields soar following the...

    Panicky selling grips the mortgage REITs (REM -3.5%) as Treasury yields soar following the payroll report. American Capital (AGNC -6.9%), (MTGE -5%), Annaly (NLY -6.9%) Chimera (CIM -4.9%), Armour (ARR -3.9%), Invesco (IVR -2.7%), CYS Investments (CYS -3%). CYS' Kevin Grant was public a month ago about being a happy buyer as yields rose - a bit early on that call.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 103 Comments
  • LSG

    Lake Shore Gold (NYSEMKT:LSG) +3.4% premarket after saying it recorded gold output of 30,800 oz....

    Lake Shore Gold (NYSEMKT:LSG) +3.4% premarket after saying it recorded gold output of 30,800 oz. during Q2, up 26% Y/Y and 33% Q/Q. Mill throughput averaged 2,540 tons/day and more than 2,800 tons/day during the final three weeks of June. Average grades improved throughout the quarter: 3.9 grams/ton in April, 4.5 in May, 4.6 in June.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) dip 1.2% premarket off of news that Chairman Dennis Wilson is...

    Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) dip 1.2% premarket off of news that Chairman Dennis Wilson is looking to sell up to 3.4M shares of the company. The buzz from traders is that the insider sale when combined with an ongoing CEO search gives the appearance that no one has a firm handle on the retailer's rudder.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 3 Comments
  • AU

    Premarket Losers: AU -6%. HMY -6%.

    Premarket Losers: AU -6%. HMY -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • RH

    Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH) files a registration statement with the SEC related to an...

    Restoration Hardware (NYSE:RH) files a registration statement with the SEC related to an offering of 10M shares by existing shareholders. RH -2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • GOLD

    Precious metals miners prepare for another beating after June non-farm payrolls topped...

    Precious metals miners prepare for another beating after June non-farm payrolls topped estimates, sending the dollar higher and gold prices tumbling. GDX -2.7%, ABX -2.8%, AU -5.3%, NEM -1.9%, GG -2.9%, AUY -4.2%, SLW -2%, KGC -3.7%, GOLD -2.9%, EGO -3.4%, AEM -3.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 3 Comments
  • UUP

    The dollar adds to strong gains following the better-than-expected NFP print. The greenback was...

    The dollar adds to strong gains following the better-than-expected NFP print. The greenback was already higher - notably vs. the euro and sterling - following the dovish tilt of the ECB and BOE policy meetings yesterday. It's also solidly back over ¥100, up 1% and buying ¥101.06. UUP +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM

  • Gold tumbles (GLD -2.2%) as the strong employment print at a minimum won't derail the momentum...

    Gold tumbles (GLD -2.2%) as the strong employment print at a minimum won't derail the momentum of the QE-taper. Silver (SLV -3.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 8 Comments
  • TSL

    A top Chinese industry official is "highly optimistic" about resolving the solar trade spat with...

    A top Chinese industry official is "highly optimistic" about resolving the solar trade spat with the EU by next month, as Beijing reportedly has made a new settlement offer. The solar dispute has the potential to affect €21B of imported Chinese solar panels, cells and wafers from manufacturers such as Trina Solar, Yingli Green Energy and Suntech. TSL +1.8%, YGE +1.5%, SPWR +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) slips 3.79% premarket on the heels of a pre-holiday...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) slips 3.79% premarket on the heels of a pre-holiday announcement regarding an at-the-market equity offering agreement with Further Lane Securities under which the company may sell shares worth up to $125M in order to fund general corporate purposes including activities related to eteplirsen.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM

  • A check of oil prices following the coup in Egypt found them little-changed until moments ago...

    A check of oil prices following the coup in Egypt found them little-changed until moments ago when Egypt announced a state of emergency in Suez after an attack on Sinai Airport. August WTI crude (USO) pops to $101.80 and Brent Crude (BNO) to $106.48.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) says early demand for Model S vehicles from Hong Kong is strong even...

    Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) says early demand for Model S vehicles from Hong Kong is strong even though the automaker hasn't set a price yet for the EV which will go on sale in the city this winter. TSLA +3.7% premarket to $119.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 AM | 47 Comments

  • Some European indexes (FEZ) turn lower as the heady rush to the blood from Mario Draghi's...

    Some European indexes (FEZ) turn lower as the heady rush to the blood from Mario Draghi's comments yesterday wears off and some analysts provide critical analysis of his remarks, and as investors focus on the upcoming U.S. jobs data. "I think what we've seen once again is a commitment to nothing, and the markets have just taken the bait," says Alpari U.K.'s Craig Erlam. U.S. futures remain higher, though. EU Stoxx 50 -0.1%, London +0.3%, Paris -0.1%, Frankfurt flat, Milan -0.3%, Madrid -0.5%. Dow (DIA) +0.9%. S&P (SPY) +0.9%. Nasdaq (QQQ) +0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • FEZ

    European shares (NYSEARCA:FEZ) are flat-to-higher as they build on yesterday's sharp gains after...

    European shares (NYSEARCA:FEZ) are flat-to-higher as they build on yesterday's sharp gains after the BOE and the ECB's Mario Draghi injected rocket fuel into markets with their surprising decisions to say that super-low interest rates are here to stay. All eyes are now on the U.S. jobs report later, but given its potential impact on Fed tapering, who knows what the reaction will be. EU Stoxx 50 +0.1%, London +0.3%, Paris flat, Frankfurt +0.3%, Milan +0.2%, Madrid flat.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 AM

  • Asian shares surf the wave of joy sparked by the BOE and the ECB's Mario Draghi yesterday...

    Asian shares surf the wave of joy sparked by the BOE and the ECB's Mario Draghi yesterday pledging to maintain their easy money policies for the foreseeable future, although there's been a bit of caution ahead of the U.S. nonfarm payrolls report later today. Japan +2.1%, Hong Kong +1.6%, China +0.1%, India +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 AM
